title: ECON1550 International Finance
text:
Where to Find Course Materials
Canvas is the official home for this course. Everything you need—announcements, assignments, grades, policies, and course materials—is available there.
This website and the GitHub repository mirror the course materials and offer a few extras:

LaTeX source files — edit or build upon the original source code for problem sets and notes
Modification dates — see exactly when each file was last updated
Repo history — see exactly what changed in each update
Programmatic access — clone the repo or use the GitHub API to automate your workflow
Frequently Asked Questions — answers to common questions about the course

If you just want to download PDFs, Canvas is simpler. This site is here for those who want more.

title: Accessibility
text:
Accessibility Statement
The ECON1550 International Finance course website is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for all users, including those with disabilities.

Standards
We aim to conform to WCAG 2.1 Level AA standards.


Features
This site includes the following accessibility features:

Semantic HTML structure with proper heading hierarchy
Keyboard navigation support with skip-to-content link
Responsive design for various devices and screen sizes
Sufficient color contrast
Descriptive link text



Feedback
If you encounter any accessibility barriers on this site, please submit an issue on our GitHub repository.


Reporting Issues
Please include:

The web address (URL) of the content
A description of the issue

title: Frequently Asked Questions
text:
Skip to main content






Will lectures be recorded?
No. Lectures are not recorded. If you miss class, get notes from a classmate and come to office hours with questions.


Do I need the textbook version sold through Canvas or the Brown Bookstore?
No. You are welcome to use any edition or format of the textbook. The course does not rely on any proprietary or interactive features tied to a specific version.


Why are we using the 11th edition of the textbook when there is a 12th edition available?
The Brown Bookstore only had the 11th edition available in Inclusive Access form. You can certainly use the 12th edition — it has the same content, but charts and figures are updated and some boxes cover more recent events.


I earned what would have been an A while taking the course S/NC. Why don’t I see S_DIST on my transcript?
As stated on the Grade Options page,

“S with Distinction grades are not recorded on your Brown transcript or your internal academic record.”

Therefore, even though in this course we do award S_DIST, and Prof. Duarte does enter S_DIST as your grade, you will still see “S.”
The Registrar keeps a separate list of S_DIST awarded for internal academic uses such as honors eligibility. If you need confirmation, the Registrar can verify it for you.



Are there sections during exam weeks?
No.


Are there review sessions during exam weeks?
Yes.


Do we get practice exams?
Yes, at least one week before the actual exam takes place. The format and style of the actual exam will be the same as for the practice exam. We also aim to make the difficulty and length of the actual and practice exams as similar as possible.








NoteStill have questions?



For questions about problem sets, course content, or anything time-sensitive, post on Ed Discussion — you’ll get a faster response there. For general questions you think should be added to this FAQ, submit them here.
